Thirdly: commencing at the southwest corner of Section 6, Township 7, ECM, being a point on the southerly boundary of the Province;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of the Province to a point lying due South of the southeast corner of Lot 12 of Section 6, Township 7, Plan 3240;

thence due North to the southeast corner of Lot 12, Plan 3240;

thence northerly along the easterly boundaries of Lots 12, 13 and 15, Plan 3240, to a point on the easterly boundary of Lot 15 lying due East of the northeast corner of the 0.1295 hectare (0.32 acre) portion of Lot 15 as shown on Sketch Plan 7182;

thence due West to the northeast corner of 0.1295 hectare (0.32 acre) portion of Lot 15, as shown on Sketch Plan 7182, and continuing westerly along the northerly boundary of 0.1295 hectare parcel and the westerly prolongation of the northerly boundary, produced to the westerly boundary of Section 6, Township 7, ECM;

thence northerly along the westerly boundary of Section 6, Township 7, ECM a distance of 56.87 metres;

thence due West to the westerly boundary of Peace Arch Highway right of way, as shown on Plan 5391;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of Peace Arch Highway right of way, as shown on Plan 5391, and continuing southerly along the westerly boundary of the 0.2428 hectare (0.60 acre) portion of "Semiahmoo" Indian Reserve, as shown on Sketch Plan 7555, to the southerly boundary of the Province;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of the Province to the southwest corner of Section 6, Township 7, ECM, being the point of commencement;

except those portions of the Peace Arch Highway right of way deemed to be arterial highways and contained within the described boundaries of Plan 5391.

The whole park containing approximately 9 hectares.

thence in a general northerly direction along the right of way of the Topley Landing Road 118 a distance of 1.33 kilometres;

thence due North 1.01 kilometres;

thence due East 120.70 metres;

thence due North 80.47 metres;

thence due East approximately 151 metres to the natural boundary of Babine Lake;

thence in a general southerly, then easterly, then southerly, then westerly and then southerly direction following the natural boundary of Babine Lake to a westerly and then southerly direction following the natural boundary of Babine Lake to the point of commencement;

except the Crown land that is the subject of the right of way of the Topley Landing Road 118, shown on Road Survey Plan 5778 and containing approximately 83 hectares.

Secondly: all foreshore described as commencing at the northeast corner of Lot 7911, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Babine Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along the westerly shore natural boundary of Babine Lake to a point lying due West of another point lying 2.29 kilometres due North from the northeast corner of Lot 7911;

thence due East 100 metres;

thence in a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Babine Lake following a general southerly direction to a point lying 100 metres due East of the most easterly point of Red Bluff Point, being 310 metres East and 1.57 kilometres north of the northeast corner of Lot 7911;

thence southwesterly in a straight line to the point of commencement and containing approximately 65 hectares.

The whole park containing approximately 148 hectares.

SHUSWAP LAKE MARINE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Albas Site

Firstly: District Lots 3410 and 2831;

Fractional Legal Subdivisions 12 & 13 of Section 1, Township 26, Range 8, W6M;

Fractional Legal Subdivision 9, Fractional Legal Subdivision 11, the easterly 121 metres of Fractional Legal Subdivision 12, that part of Fractional Legal Subdivision 15 lying East of BCFS Road (Project 724,03) & Legal Subdivision 16 all of Section 2, Township 26, Range. 8, W6M, Blocks A & B of Legal Subdivision 15 of Section 2, Township 26, Range 8, W6M, L A of Legal Subdivision 10 of Section 2, Township 26, Range 8, W6M, Pl. 20185 except Parcels A & B (H59221);

Parcel B (H59221) of Legal Subdivision 10 of Section 2, Township 26, Range 8, W6M.

Secondly: that part of the road allowance within Legal Subdivision 15 of Section 2, Township 26, Range 8 W6M described as commencing at the northeast corner of Block A of Legal Subdivision 15;

thence northeast in a straight line to the northwest corner of Block B of Legal Subdivision 15;

thence southerly along the West boundary of Block B to the southerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 15;

thence westerly along the southerly boundary to the southeast corner of Block A of Legal Subdivision 15;

thence North along the East boundary of Block A to the point of commencement.

Thirdly: commencing at the northwest corner of District Lot 5828, being a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence easterly along the North boundary of District Lot 5828;

thence southwesterly in a straight line to a point lying 100 metres due East of the southeast corner of District Lot 5828;

thence in a general southerly then westerly direction along a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point on the line lying due South of a point on the natural boundary, the point on the natural boundary lies 121 metres West and approximately 340 metres South from the northeast corner of Legal Subdivision 12 of Section 2, Township 26, Range 8, W6M;

thence due North to the natural boundary;

thence in a general easterly then northerly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 124 hectares (101 hectares of upland and 23 hectares of foreshore).

Aline Hill Site

Commencing at the Witness Post in a Stone Mound on the southerly boundary of Section 10, Township 23, Range 8, W6M as shown on Dominion Township Plan of the southwest 1/4 of Township 23, Range 8, W6M dated at Ottawa, November 22, 1911;

thence due East to a point parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of a point lying 804.7 metres due North of the point of commencement;

thence due West to a point on the upland being parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southwesterly direction parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake at the point lying due West of the point of commencement;

thence due East to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 20 hectares (10 hectares of upland and 10 hectares of foreshore).

Anstey View Site

Firstly: Fractional southeast 1/4 of Legal Subdivision 10 and the Fractional east 1/2 of Legal Subdivision 7 of Section 12, Township 24, Range 8, W6M, Kamloops Division, Yale District.

Secondly: commencing at a point lying 360 metres East and approximately 201 metres North of the southwest corner of Legal Subdivision 10 of Section 12, Township 24, Range 8, W6M, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due East 100 metres;

thence in a general southerly direction parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of a point described as lying 201 metres East and approximately 70 metres North of the southwest corner of Legal Subdivision 7 of Section 12, Township 24, Range 8, W6M;

thence due West to the described point, being also a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 12.5 hectares (6.5 hectares of upland and 6 hectares of foreshore).

Beach Bay Site

The described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1885.

The whole site containing approximately 67 hectares (50 hectares of upland and 17 hectares of foreshore).

Bughouse Bay Site

The described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 10 Tube 1876.

The whole site containing approximately 34 hectares (13 hectares of upland and 21 hectares of foreshore).

Cottonwood Beach Site

Commencing at a point on the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake, lying due North a distance of 260 metres and due West a distance of approximately 20 metres from the southwest corner of the Fractional northeast 1/4 of Section 35, Township 24, Range 8, W6M, as shown on Dominion Township Plan of northeast 1/4 of Township 24, dated at Ottawa, May 9, 1912;

thence due East to a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a southwesterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due South a distance of 380 metres and due West a distance of approximately 640 metres from the southwest corner of the northeast 1/4 of the Section 35;

thence southeast along a straight line a distance of 200 metres to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due West of the point of commencement;

thence due East to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 12 hectares (6 hectares of upland and 6 hectares of foreshore).

Encounter Point Site

Commencing at the Iron Post and Stone Mound set at the southwest corner of Fractional Section 14, Township 25, Range 8, W6M, as shown on Dominion Township Plan of southeast 1/4 of Township 25, Range 8, W6M, dated at Ottawa, May 9, 1912;

thence due West a distance of 100.6 metres;

thence due South a distance of 402.3 metres;

thence due West a distance of 100 metres;

thence due South a distance of 402.3 metres;

thence due East a distance of approximately 140 metres to the westerly shore natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake, and continuing due East along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly shore natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence northerly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of the Witness Post marking the northwest corner of the Fractional southwest 1/4 of Section 14;

thence due West crossing the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the Witness Post;

thence southerly in a straight line to the Iron Post and Stone Mound set at the southwest corner of Fractional Section 14, being the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 41 hectares (23 hectares of upland and 18 hectares of foreshore).

Fowler Point Site

Firstly: the Fractional west 1/2 of Section 18, Township 26, Range 7, W6M.

Secondly: commencing at the most southerly southeast corner of District Lot 2920, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due East 100 metres;

thence in a general southerly direction parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the point of intersection of the easterly boundary of District Lot 2912 with the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence northwesterly 100 metres to the point of intersection of the easterly boundary of District Lot 2912;

thence in a general northerly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 21.4 hectares (8.9 hectares of upland and 12.5 hectares of foreshore).

Hungry Cove Site

Commencing at a point on the natural boundary of Anstey Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake, lying due South a distance of 460 metres and due West a distance of approximately 210 metres from the southeast corner of Block C, Section 22, Township 22, Range 8, W6M as shown on Official Plan 2T775 on file with the Surveyor General of British Columbia;

thence due West along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point on a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Anstey Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence southerly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due North a distance of 201.2 metres and due West a distance of approximately 563 metres from the southeast corner of Fractional Section 16, Township 22, Range 8, W6M as shown on Dominion Township Plan of the southwest 1/4, Township 22, Range 8, W6M, dated at Ottawa, October 21, 1919;

thence due East to a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing due East to a point lying due North a distance of 201.2 metres, and due East a distance of approximately 201.2 metres from the southeast corner of Fractional Section 16;

thence due North a distance of 1.01 kilometres;

thence due West a distance of 201.2 metres;

thence due North a distance of 803.5 metres;

thence due East a distance of 100.6 metres;

thence due North to a point lying due East of the point of commencement;

thence due West to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 86.2 hectares (62.2 hectares of upland and 24 hectares of foreshore).

Mara Point Site

Firstly: that part of Fractional Legal Subdivision 14, Section 24, Township 21, Range 8, W6M lying east of Plan A-402, being the Canadian Pacific Railway right of way.

Secondly: commencing at the point of intersection of the north boundary of Fractional Legal Subdivision 14, Section 24, Township 21, Range 8, W6M and the westerly natural boundary of Mara Lake;

thence east 100 metres along the easterly production of the north boundary of Fractional Legal Subdivision 14, Section 24, Township 21, Range 8, W6M to the point of intersection with a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly natural boundary of Mara Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along that line to a point being due East of the most southerly point of that part of Fractional Legal Subdivision 14, Section 24, Township 21, Range 8, W6M, lying east of Plan A-402, being the Canadian Pacific Railway right of way;

thence due West to the point of intersection with the westerly natural boundary of Mara Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along the westerly natural boundary of Mara Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 5.8 hectares (3.8 hectares of upland and 2 hectares of foreshore).

Marble Point Site

Firstly: commencing at the northwest corner of Block A, Section 22, Township 22, Range 8, W6M as shown on Official Plan 2T775 on file with the Surveyor General of British Columbia and being on the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence due West to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distance from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant in a straight line from the northwest corner of District Lot 1851;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the northwest corner of District Lot 1851, being a point on the easterly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence Easterly and southerly along the northerly and easterly boundaries of District Lots 1851 and 1850 to the most southeast corner of District Lot 1850;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 153°01'15" to a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southwesterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East a distance of 402 metres and due North a distance of approximately 260 metres from the northeast corner of Fractional east 1/2 of southwest 1/4, Section 34, Township 22, Range 8, W6M;

thence due South to a point lying due East of the northeast corner of Fractional east 1/2 of southwest 1/4, Section 34, Township 22, Range 8, W6M;

thence southwesterly in a straight line to the northeast corner of Fractional west 1/2 of northwest 1/4, Section 27, Township 22, Range 8, W6M;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of the Fractional west 1/2 to the southeast corner of the Fractional west 1/2;

thence due South a distance of 201 metres;

thence due West to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of the northeast corner of Block A, Section 22, Township 22, Range 8, W6M;

thence due West to the northeast corner of Block A and continuing westerly along the northerly boundary of Block A to the northwest of Block A, being the point of commencement.

Secondly: commencing at the most southerly corner of District Lot 1852;

thence northerly along the westerly boundary of District Lot 1852 to the northwest corner of District Lot 1852, being a point on the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence northeasterly in a straight line to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the northwest corner of District Lot 1852;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the most northerly corner of District Lot 1853;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the most northerly corner of District Lot 1853 and continuing southeasterly along the northeasterly boundary of District Lot 1853 to the most easterly corner of District Lot 1853;

thence southwesterly along the southeasterly boundaries of District Lots 1853 and 1852 to the most southerly corner of District Lot 1852, being the point of commencement.

Thirdly: commencing at the northeast corner of Block A of District Lot 6056;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 6056 to the northwest corner of District Lot 6056, being a point on the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence due West to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the northwest corner of District Lot 6057;

thence easterly in a straight line to the northwest corner of District Lot 6057, being a point on the natural boundary of Salmon Arm of Shuswap Lake;

thence easterly and southerly along the northerly and easterly boundaries of District Lots 6057 and 6056 to the northeast corner of Block A of District Lot 6056, being the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 174.9 hectares (111.7 hectares of upland and 63.2 hectares of foreshore).

Nielsen Beach Site

Commencing at a point on the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the easterly shore of Shuswap Lake, lying due West a distance of approximately 362 metres from the iron post set at the northeast corner of Fractional Section 3, Township 24, Range 8, W6M as shown on Dominion Township Plan of the southeast 1/4 of Township 24, Range 8, W6M, dated at Ottawa, April 30, 1912;

thence due West along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary;

thence southeasterly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due South a distance of 805 metres and due West a distance of approximately 120 metres from the northeast corner of Fractional Section 3, Township 24, Range 8, W6M;

thence due East to the easterly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing due East to a point lying due South of the iron post set in at the northeast corner of Fractional Section 3;

thence due North a distance of 503 metres;

thence due West to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the easterly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence northwesterly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East from the point of commencement;

thence due West to the point of commencement, being a point on the easterly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake.

The whole site containing approximately 17.6 hectares (9.1 hectares of upland and 8.5 hectares of foreshore).

Paradise Point Site

Firstly: Legal Subdivisions 15 and 16 and Fractional Legal Subdivision 9 of Section 22, Township 21, Range 9, W6M and the Fractional northwest 1/4 of Section 23, Township 21, Range 9, W6M.

Secondly: commencing at the point of intersection of the northerly boundary of Section 23, Township 21, Range 9, W6M with the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence southeasterly 100 metres perpendicular to the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southwesterly direction parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the point of intersection of the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake with the westerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 9 of Section 22, Township 21, Range 9, W6M;

thence northwesterly 100 metres to that point of intersection;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 65.5 hectares (53 hectares of upland and 12.5 hectares of foreshore).

Roberts Bay Site

Firstly: Lot 1, Section 8, Township 24, Range 7, W6M, Plan KAP64470.

Secondly: commencing at the point of intersection of the north boundary of Lot 1 of Fractional Section 8, Township 24, Range 7, W6M, Plan KAP64470 and the easterly natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence westerly 100 metres along the westerly production of the north boundary of Lot 1 to the point of intersection with a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the easterly natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along that line to a point lying due West of the most southerly point of Lot 1, Section 8, Township 24, Range 7, W6M, Plan KAP64470;

thence due East to the point of intersection with the easterly natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along the easterly natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 26 hectares (21 hectares of upland and 5 hectares of foreshore).

except the Ministry of Forests and Range Forest Service Road shown on Plan 7 Tube 2001 deposited in the Crown Land Registry.

Tiilis Beach Site

Commencing at the northwest corner of the Fractional southwest 1/4 of Section 32, Township 22, Range 8, W6M;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of the Fractional southwest 1/4 of Section 32 to an iron post as shown on Dominion Township Plan of the northwest 1/4 of Township 22, Range 8, W6M, dated at Ottawa, June 21, 1922, being 404.8 metres from the northeast corner;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 89°56' to the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence along a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the intersection with the easterly prolongation of the northerly boundary of the Fractional southwest 1/4 of Section 32;

thence westerly along the easterly prolongation of the northerly boundary of Section 32 to the northwest corner of Section 32, being a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing westerly along the northerly boundary of the Fractional southwest 1/4 of Section 32 to the northwest corner of Section 32, being the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 27 hectares (23 hectares of upland and 4 hectares of foreshore).

Twin Bays Site

Firstly: Fractional Legal Subdivision 1 of Section 19, and Fractional Legal Subdivision 4 of Section 20, Township 24, Range 7, W6M.

Secondly: commencing at the point of intersection of the northerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 4 of Section 20, Township 24, Range 7, W6M to the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due West to the most southerly southeast corner of Legal Subdivision 1, being also a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 15.3 hectares (7.3 hectares of upland and 8 hectares of foreshore).

Two Mile Creek Site

Firstly: Fractional Legal Subdivision 4 and that portion of Legal Subdivision 5 lying South of Two Mile Creek, Section 35, Township 25, Range 8, W6M.

Secondly: commencing at the point of intersection of the right bank of Two Mile Creek with the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence southeasterly 100 metres perpendicular to the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of the intersection of the southerly boundary of Section 35, Township 25, Range 8, W6M with the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due East 100 metres to that point;

thence northerly along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 17.1 hectares (8.1 hectares of upland and 9 hectares of foreshore).

Woods Landing Site

Commencing at a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake lying due South 280 metres and due West approximately 25 metres from the southwest corner of District Lot 5826;

thence due West 105 metres to a point lying due East approximately 15 metres from the centerline of the Woods Landing access road;

thence due North 840 metres;

thence due East to the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing in a straight line along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along a line parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due East of the point of commencement;

thence due West to the point of commencement.

Woods Landing South Site

Commencing at a point lying due South 895 metres and due West approximately 1 320 metres from the southwest corner of the southeast 1/4 of Section 22, Township 24, Range 8, W6M, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due West 120 metres;

thence due South 500 metres;

thence due East to the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake and continuing in a straight line along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due West to the point of commencement.

The whole site containing approximately 10.5 hectares (5.5 hectares of upland and 5 hectares of foreshore).

The whole park containing approximately 894.33 hectares (600.05 hectares of upland and 294.28 hectares of foreshore).

SHUSWAP LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 1978.

The whole park containing approximately 154 hectares (120 hectares of upland and 34 hectares of foreshore).

SILVER BEACH PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: commencing at the northwest corner of Block E of District Lot 612, as shown on Plan 11425;

thence southwesterly along the westerly boundary of Block E of District Lot 612, Plan 11425 and the southwesterly prolongation of the westerly boundary of Block E of District Lot 612, Plan 11425, produced to the intersection with a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake, on the northerly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence southeasterly, northerly and southeasterly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Seymour Arm of Shuswap Lake to the intersection with a straight line drawn southwesterly on a bearing of 194° from the southeast corner of Lot 6 of District Lot 663, Plan 5824;

thence northeasterly in a straight line on a bearing of 14° to the southeast corner of Lot 6 of District Lot 663, Plan 5824;

thence northerly along the most easterly boundary of Lot 6, Plan 5824, to a point lying 237 metres southerly from the most easterly northeast corner of Lot 6, Plan 5824, along the most easterly boundary of Lot 6;

thence northwesterly in a straight line on a bearing of 287° a distance of 83.8 metres;

thence due North a distance of 91.4 metres;

thence due East to the most easterly boundary of Lot 6 of District Lot 663, Plan 5824;

thence northerly along the most easterly boundary of Lot 6, Plan 5824, to the most easterly northeast corner of Lot 6;

thence westerly and northerly along the northerly and easterly boundaries of Lot 6, Plan 5824, and continuing northerly along the northerly prolongation of the easterly boundary of Lot 6, Plan 5824, produced to the right bank natural boundary of Seymour River;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the right bank natural boundary of Seymour River to the northerly boundary of District Lot 663;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 663 to a point lying due North of the northeast corner of Lot 3 of Block 2 of District Lot 663, Plan 562;

thence due South to the northeast corner of Lot 3 of Block 2, Plan 562;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of Lot 3 of Block 2, Plan 652 to the most northerly southeast corner of Lot 3, being a point on the right bank natural boundary of Seymour River;

thence southwesterly along the right bank natural boundary of Seymour River, to the most southerly southeast corner of Lot 3 of Block 2, Plan 562, being a point;

thence westerly along the southerly boundaries of Lot 3 of Block 2, Plan 562 and Lot A of District Lot 663, Plan KAP 48203 to the southwest corner of Lot A, Plan KAP 48203;

thence northerly along the westerly boundary of Lot A, Plan KAP 48203 and the northerly production of Lot A, produced to the northerly boundary of District Lot 663;

thence westerly and southerly along the northerly and westerly boundaries of District Lot 663 to the northeast corner of Block E of District Lot 612, Plan 11425, being a point on the westerly boundary of District Lot 663;

thence northwesterly along the northerly boundary of Block E, Plan 11425, to the northwest corner of Block E, being the point of commencement.

Secondly: commencing at the southwest corner of Lot 21 of District Lot 2946, as shown on Plan 7643, being a point on the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due South along the bed of Shuswap Lake to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence southeasterly along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due South of the southeast corner of Lot 22 of District Lot 2946, Plan 7634;

thence due North to the southeast corner of Lot 22, Plan 7634 and continuing westerly along the northerly boundaries of Lots 16 to 21 of District Lot 2946, Plan 7634, to the northwest corner of Lot 21 of District Lot 2946, Plan 7634;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of Lot 21, Plan 7634, to the southwest corner of Lot 21, being the point of commencement.

Thirdly: that portion of District Lot 2946, shown dedicated as "Park" on Plan 10404 together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, more particularly described as commencing at the southeast corner of Lot A of District Lot 2946, as shown on Plan 15335, being a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake, on the westerly shore of Shuswap Lake;

thence southeasterly in a straight line on a bearing of 110° to a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southwesterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 100 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to a point lying due South of the southeast corner of Lot 2 of District Lot 946, Plan 10404, being a point on the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence due North to the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general northerly direction along the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the southeast corner of Lot A of District Lot 2946, Plan 15335, being a point on the natural boundary, and the point of commencement.

Fourthly: commencing at the southeast corner of Lot 3 of District Lot 2946, as shown on Plan 15424, being a point on the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence northwesterly along the easterly boundary of Lot 3, Plan 15424, to the southwest corner of Lot A of District Lot 946, Plan 32136;

thence northeasterly along the southerly boundary of Lot A, Plan 32136, to the southeast corner of Lot A, being a point on the westerly boundary of Seymour Arm Road;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of Seymour Arm Road, as shown on Plan 7634, and continuing southerly along the southerly prolongation of the westerly boundary of Seymour Arm Road, produced for a distance of 61 metres;

thence due West to a point lying due South of the point of commencement;

thence due North to the southeast corner of Lot 3 of District Lot 2946, Plan 15424, being a point on the northerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake, and the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 129.8 hectares (101.2 hectares of upland and 28.6 hectares of foreshore).

SILVER LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

The whole park containing approximately 76.89 hectares.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Osoyoos Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 1876; except (1) Silver Star Road right of way as shown on Ministry of Highways Drawings numbered 67/1306-2 and 67/1306-3 filed in the Vernon Highway District Office (Gazetted July 12, 1984); and (2) Sovereign Lake Access Road as shown on Crown Land Registry Plan 1 Tube 1533.

District Lots 1540, 2070, 2071 and 2436.

SKAGIT VALLEY PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Yale Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at International Boundary Monument No. 73, being the southwesterly corner of E.C. Manning Park;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the summit of Shawatum Mountain, being the westerly boundary of E.C. Manning Park;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the easterly boundary of the watershed of Shawatum Creek to the point of intersection with the southerly boundary of the watershed of Twentysix Mile Creek;

thence northwesterly along the southerly boundary of the watershed of Twentysix Mile Creek to the summit of Mount Brice;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 2°30' a distance of approximately 3.5 kilometres to a point on the height of land lying westerly of Hatchethead Mountain;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the southeast corner of District Lot 1725;

thence northwesterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 1725 to a point lying parallel to and 250 metres perpendicularly distant from the left bank natural boundary of Skagit River;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 250 metres perpendicularly distant from the left bank natural boundary of Skagit River to the point of intersection with the boundary of E. C. Manning Park;

thence northwesterly along the boundary of E. C. Manning Park to its intersection with the easterly boundary of Section 13, Township 3, Range 24, W6M;

thence southerly and westerly along the easterly and southerly boundaries of Section 13 to the height of land that forms the northerly boundary of the watershed of the Skagit River;

thence in a general southwesterly direction along the northerly watershed boundary of the Skagit River to a point lying due North of the northeast corner of Lot 410;

thence due South to the northeast corner of Lot 410;

thence southerly and westerly along the easterly and southerly boundaries of Lot 410 to the height of land that forms the easterly watershed boundary of Maselpanik Creek;

thence southerly along that height of land to the International Boundary;

thence easterly along the International Boundary to Boundary Monument No. 73, being the point of commencement;

except (1) Skagit River Forest Ecological Reserve; (2) Ross Lake Ecological Reserve; (3) Skagit River Cottonwoods Ecological Reserve; and (4) Skagit River Rhododendrons Ecological Reserve.

The whole park containing approximately 27 964 hectares.

SKIHIST PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 1995; except the Trans-Canada Highway No. 1, as shown on the Official Plans deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 996 and Plan 13 Tube 1615.

SKOOKUMCHUCK NARROWS PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Group 1, New Westminster District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: commencing at the southeast corner of District Lot 1577, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Skookumchuck Narrows;

thence westerly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 1577 to a point lying 422.5 metres distant from the southwest corner of District Lot 1577;

thence due North a distance of 360 metres;

thence due West to a point lying due South of a point on the southerly boundary of District Lot 6257 lying 50 metres distant from the southeast corner of District Lot 6257;

thence due North to the southerly boundary of District Lot 6257;

thence easterly and northerly along the southerly and easterly boundaries of District Lot 6257 to the southwest corner of District Lot 5943;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 5943 to the westerly boundary of District Lot 5944;

thence southerly, easterly and northerly along the westerly, southerly and easterly boundaries of District Lot 5944 to the southwest corner of District Lot 5942;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 5942 to the westerly boundary of District Lot 1577;

thence northerly along the westerly boundary of District Lot 1577 to a point lying due West of the southwest corner of Block A of District Lot 1577, as shown on Reference Plan 2929;

thence due East to the southwest corner of Block A of District Lot 1577, Reference Plan 2929;

thence easterly and northerly along the southerly and easterly boundaries of Block A of District Lot 1577, Reference Plan 2929, to the northeast corner of Block A of District Lot 1577, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Skookumchuck Narrows;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along the westerly shore natural boundary of Skookumchuck Narrows to the southeast corner of District Lot 1577, being a point on the natural boundary of Skookumchuck Narrows, and the point of commencement.

Secondly: District Lot 2991, except Plan 19477.

Thirdly: Boom Islet and Sechelt Islets, the seven unsurveyed islets situated in Skookumchuck Narrows and lying adjacent to District Lot 1577.

The whole park containing approximately 123 hectares.

thence southwesterly in a straight line to the interior corner of District Lot 476;

thence due North to the left bank natural boundary of Stamp River;

thence southerly along the left bank natural boundary of Stamp River to the most southerly southwest corner of District Lot 80 E & N, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 327 hectares.

STONE MOUNTAIN PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Peace River District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at Standard Pipe Post No. 231 set on the northerly boundary of Alaska Highway right of way at approximately Mile 390, as shown on Plan H464;

thence due North to the northerly boundary of the watershed of North Tetsa River;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the northerly boundaries of the watersheds of North Tetsa River and MacDonald Creek, passing through the summit of Mount St. Paul, to the headwaters of an unnamed creek which flows southwesterly into MacDonald Creek at a point near the mouth of One Ten Creek;

thence southwesterly to and along the right bank natural boundary of an unnamed creek to its intersection with the right bank natural boundary of MacDonald Creek;

thence westerly along the right bank natural boundary of MacDonald Creek to a point lying due North of the intersection of the natural boundaries of MacDonald Creek with the left bank natural boundary of One Ten Creek;

thence due South to the intersection of the natural boundaries of MacDonald Creek;

thence in a general southerly direction along the left bank natural boundary of One Ten Creek to the headwaters of One Ten Creek;

thence due East to the westerly boundary of the watershed of MacDonald Creek;

thence in a general southerly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of MacDonald Creek to the summit of Mount St. Magnus, being a point;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the easterly boundary of the watershed of MacDonald Creek, the southeasterly boundary of the watershed of the mainstream of North Tetsa River and the southeasterly boundary of the watershed of the unnamed creek flowing in a general northerly direction into North Tetsa River at a point approximately 1.3 kilometres easterly from the most easterly point of Summit Lake, to a point lying due South of the point of commencement;

thence due North to Standard Pipe Post No. 231 set on the northerly boundary of Alaska Highway right of way at approximately Mile 390, as shown on Plan H464, being the point of commencement;

except (1) District Lots 1625, 1626 and 1627; and (2) Alaska Highway right of way as shown on Plans H464, H497 and H516.

The whole park containing approximately 25 690 hectares.

SYDNEY INLET PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Clayoquot District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at a point lying due East 700 metres and due South approximately 40 metres from the northeast corner of District Lot 316, being a point on the northerly shore natural boundary of Stewardson Inlet;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 351° to the intersection with the westerly boundary of the watershed of Sydney Inlet;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of Sydney Inlet to a point lying due West 1.25 kilometres and due South approximately 100 metres from the southwest corner of "Kishnacous" Indian Reserve No. 29;

thence on a bearing of 312° a distance of 580 metres;

thence on a bearing of 355° a distance of 280 metres;

thence on a bearing of 49° a distance of approximately 1.0 kilometre to a southwest corner of District Lot 653;

thence due East approximately 1.44 kilometres to a point on the westerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek flowing in a general northwesterly direction into Sydney River at a point lying due West 100 metres and due North approximately 800 metres from the northeast corner of "Kishnacous" Indian Reserve No. 29;

thence in a general southerly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek to the intersection with the easterly boundary of the watershed of Sydney Inlet;

thence in a general southerly direction along the easterly boundary of the watershed of the Sydney Inlet to a point lying due South 1.3 kilometres and due East approximately 3.2 kilometres from the northeast corner of District Lot 316;

thence due South to a point on the natural boundary of Sydney Inlet;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 226° to a point on the natural boundary of Sydney Inlet on the westerly shore of Sydney Inlet;

thence due West to the intersection with the westerly boundary of the watershed of Stewardson Inlet;

thence in a northwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of Stewardson Inlet to the intersection with the southerly boundary of the watershed of Stewardson Inlet;

thence in a northwesterly direction along the southerly boundary of the watershed of Stewardson Inlet to the intersection with the westerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek flowing northerly into Stewardson Inlet, being due West 880 metres and due South approximately 1.0 kilometre from the northeast corner of District Lot 316;

thence in a northwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek to the intersection with the southerly shore natural boundary of Stewardson Inlet;

thence due North to a point on the southerly shore natural boundary of Darr Island, being District Lot 393;

thence in a general northerly and westerly direction along the natural boundary of Darr Island to a point lying due East 680 metres and due South approximately 120 metres from the northeast corner of Lot 316;

thence due North to a point on the northerly shore natural boundary of Stewardson Inlet lying due East 680 metres from the northeast corner of District Lot 316, being the point of commencement;

except "Kishnacous" Indian Reserve No. 29.

The whole park containing approximately 2 774.2 hectares (2 083.2 hectares of upland and 691.0 hectares of foreshore).

TS'ILɁOS PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 1, Coast District, Range 2, Coast District and Lillooet District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the southwest corner of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1, Range 2, Coast District, being a point on the easterly shore natural boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1 a distance of 650 metres;

thence due South to the intersection with a line drawn parallel to and 500 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence southerly along a line parallel to and 500 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of Chilko Lake to a point lying due South a distance of 5.95 kilometres and due East a distance of approximately 2.7 kilometres from the southwest corner of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 73° a distance of approximately 1.1 kilometres to the intersection with the 6 500 foot (1 981 metre) contour;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the 6 500 foot (1 981 metre) contour to the intersection with the most easterly tributary of an unnamed creek flowing northeasterly into Taseko River, being approximately 5.5 kilometres due West and 2.8 kilometres due North from the northwest corner of District Lot 7930, Lillooet District;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 163° a distance of 1.4 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 200° a distance of 850 metres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 169° a distance of 850 metres;

thence due South a distance of 1.5 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 217° a distance of 2.0 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 235° a distance of 2.0 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 205° a distance of 350 metres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 170° a distance of 1.5 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 159° a distance of 2.3 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 172° a distance of 1.3 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 179° a distance of 4.0 kilometres;

thence southwesterly in a straight line to Triangulation Station P.M 68A 205 (G) located West of Fishem Lake;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 220° a distance of 3.1 kilometres;

thence due South to the intersection with the height of land between the 2 unnamed forks of the most southerly tributary of Yohetta Creek and continuing southerly along the height of land to the summit of RCAF Peak;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 126° a distance of 4.0 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 165° to the intersection with the height of land between 2 unnamed creeks flowing into Tchaikazan River from the icefields west and east of Beehive Peak;

thence southerly along the height of land to the summit of Beehive Peak;

thence southeasterly along the height of land to the intersection with the unnamed peak south of the icefield southeast of Beehive Peak;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 67°, a distance of 600 metres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 104° to the intersection with the middle line of Falls River;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the summit of Mount McLeod;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 104° to the confluence of the middle lines of the northerly and southerly tributaries of an unnamed creek flowing easterly into Lord River;

thence southeasterly along the middle line to a point lying due South a distance of 600 metres and due East a distance of approximately 4.4 kilometres from the summit of Mount McLeod;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 127° to the intersection with the 5 500 foot (1 676 metre) contour;

thence southerly and easterly along that contour to a point lying parallel to and 200 metres perpendicularly distant from the middle line of an unnamed creek and most westerly tributary flowing northwesterly into Lord River;

thence southeasterly along a line drawn parallel to and 200 metres perpendicularly distant from that middle line of an unnamed creek and most westerly tributary to the most southeasterly limit of an unnamed creek, and continuing southeasterly to the summit of an unnamed mountain lying due East a distance of 9.7 kilometres and due North approximately 4.5 kilometres from the summit of Mount Perry;

thence southwesterly and westerly along the southeasterly and southerly watershed boundaries of Lord River and passing through the summits of Mount Perry, Mount Wheatley, Mount Tait, Mount Dodds, Mount Henderson, Mount Mills, Mount Porter to the summit of Mount Fulgora;

thence northerly and northwesterly along the southerly and southwesterly watershed boundaries of Chilko Lake passing through the summit of Mount Sawt and crossing Npigwq, Ramose and Norrington Glaciers to the summit of an unnamed mountain west of Norrington Glacier and north of Durham Glacier;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 3° a distance of 4.7 kilometres;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the summit of the Joker;

thence southwesterly along the height of land through the summits of Coronel and Wednesday Mountains to the summit of Scharnhorst Mountain;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 277° a distance of 1.1 kilometres;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 339° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 15° to the intersection with the height of land between Goddard Glacier and Otranto Glacier;

thence northeasterly along the height of land to the summit of Mount Marston;

thence northeasterly along the height of land between Boulanger Creek and Farrow Creek to the summit of an unnamed mountain located approximately 1.5 kilometres south of Good Hope Mountain;

thence westerly and northerly along the southerly and westerly watershed boundaries of Franklyn Arm of Chilko Lake and passing through the summits of Mount Durham and Majestic, Regal and Consort Peaks, continuing northerly to the summit of an unnamed mountain lying due West a distance of one kilometre and due North a distance of approximately 750 metres from the summit of Mount Dartmouth;

thence northerly along the westerly watershed boundary of Chilko Lake and passing through the summits of Mounts Derick, McKinney, Macphail and Whitton and continuing to a point lying due West a distance of 12.1 kilometres and due South a distance of approximately 900 metres from the southwest corner of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1, Range 2, Coast District;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 11° a distance of approximately 6.9 kilometres crossing Stikelan Pass to the summit of an unnamed mountain lying due North a distance of 3.8 kilometres and due West a distance of approximately 9.25 kilometres from the northwest corner of District Lot 1416, Range 2, Coast District, being "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve 1A;

thence northerly along the westerly watershed boundary of Chilko Lake, crossing Cheshi Pass and passing through the summit of Tullin Mountain to a point lying due South a distance of 300 metres and due West a distance of approximately 2.4 kilometres from the southwest corner of District Lot 599, Range 2, Coast District;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 56° to the intersection with the 4 500 foot (1 372 metre) contour;

thence due East a distance of 500 metres;

thence due South a distance of approximately 1.5 kilometres to the right bank natural boundary of Chilko River;

thence in a straight line to the most northerly point of an unnamed peninsula situated at the most northerly point of Chilko Lake lying on the natural boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence southeasterly along the northerly shore natural boundary of Chilko Lake, on the unnamed peninsula, to the most easterly point of the unnamed peninsula;

thence due East to the intersection with the 4 000 foot (1 219 metre) contour;

thence northeasterly along that contour to the intersection with the middle line of the most easterly tributary of an unnamed creek flowing northwesterly into Chilko River;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the 5040' Horizontal Control Point as shown on NTS Map 92 N/9, Edition 2, being a point on the easterly watershed boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence southwesterly along the watershed boundary of Chilko Lake to a point lying due North a distance of 300 metres and due West a distance of approximately 400 metres from the northwest corner of District Lot 1660, Range 2, Coast District;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the most southerly southwest corner of District Lot 1660;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 145° a distance of approximately 2.7 kilometres to a point on the easterly watershed boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence southerly and southeasterly along the easterly watershed boundary of Chilko Lake to a point lying due North a distance of 300 metres and due West a distance of approximately 1.9 kilometres from the summit of Mount Nemaia;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 210° a distance of approximately 1.3 kilometres to the intersection with the confluence of the middle lines of an unnamed creek and the most easterly tributary of the unnamed creek flowing southwesterly into Chilko Lake;

thence southwesterly along the middle line of unnamed creek to the intersection with the northerly boundary of District Lot 1416, being "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1A;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 1416 to the northwest corner of District Lot 1416 and being a point on the easterly shore natural boundary of Chilko Lake;

thence southeasterly along the westerly boundary of District Lot 1416, being "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1A and continuing southeasterly along the westerly boundary of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1A to the southwest corner of "Chilco Lake" Indian Reserve No. 1A, being the point of commencement;

except District Lot 1811, Range 2, Coast District.

The whole park containing approximately 233 240 hectares.

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of the south 1/2 of Section 33 to the northeast corner of Legal Subdivision 7;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of the Legal Subdivision 7 and continuing southerly along the easterly boundary of Legal Subdivision 2 to the southeast corner of Legal Subdivision 2;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 1 to the southeast corner of Legal Subdivision 1;

thence southerly along the westerly boundaries of Legal Subdivisions 13 and 12 of Section 27 to the northwest corner of the south 1/2 of the Legal Subdivision 12;

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of the south 1/2 of Legal Subdivision 12 and continuing easterly along the northerly boundaries of the south 1/2 of Legal Subdivisions 11 and 10 to the point of intersection with southerly boundary of Adams Plateau - Corning Forest Road as shown on Ministry of Forests' Drawing 7-81-K;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along the southerly boundary to the point of intersection with the westerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 9 of Section 27, Township 22, Range 12, W6M;

thence southerly and easterly along the westerly and southerly boundaries of the Legal Subdivision 9 to the northwest corner of the Fractional south 1/2 of Section 26;

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of the Fractional south 1/2 of Section 26 to the northeast corner of Section 26;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of the Fractional south 1/2 of Section 26 to the southeast corner of Section 26;

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of Fractional Section 24 to the westerly shore natural boundary of Shuswap Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along the natural boundary of Shuswap Lake to the westerly boundary of Fractional Section 24;

thence southerly in a straight line to the most easterly point of "Quaaout" Indian Reserve No. 1;

thence in a general westerly direction along the northerly boundary of the "Quaaout" Indian Reserve No. 1 to the intersection of the easterly boundary of the west 1/2 of the northwest 1/4 of the southeast 1/4 of Section 28, Township 22, Range 12, W6M, being the point of commencement;

except (1) Holding Road, No. 451; (2) Squilax-Anglemont Road, No. 446; (3) the road shown on Plan KAP42083 or on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 30 Tube 1465; (4) the road shown on Plan EPC #56 on file in the Crown Land Registry; and (5) the land shown on Plans KAP83136, KAP83135 and KAP48895.

Secondly: the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 11 Tube 1778, containing approximately 88 hectares.

The whole park containing approximately 1 073 hectares.

TUDYAH LAKE PARK

thence in a southerly direction along the westerly boundary of John Hart Highway, Plan H-213 and continuing in a southerly direction along the westerly boundary of John Hart Peace River Highway, Plan 28193, to a point lying 392 metres due South and approximately 100 metres due East of the southwest corner of District Lot 11627;

thence due West to the right bank natural boundary of Pack River;

thence in a general northerly direction along the right bank natural boundary of Pack River to, and in a general southerly, westerly, southerly, easterly and northerly direction along the natural boundary of a back channel of Pack River, to the southerly shore natural boundary of Tudyah Lake;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along the southerly shore natural boundary of Tudyah Lake to the most easterly northeast corner of District Lot 11609, being a point;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of District Lot 11609 to the westerly boundary of John Hart Peace River Highway, Plan 28193;

thence in a southwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of John Hart Peace River Highway, Plan 28193 and continuing in a southwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of John Hart Highway, Plan H-213 to the most easterly corner of Block A of District Lot 11627, being a point on the westerly boundary of John Hart Highway;

thence northwesterly, southwesterly and southeasterly along the northeasterly, northwesterly and southwesterly boundaries of Block A of District Lot 11627, to the most southerly corner of District Lot 11627, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 56 hectares.

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of the watershed of Precipice Creek to the westerly boundary of the watershed of Precipice Creek;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of the watershed of Jobin Creek to UTM North 5754566 metres;

thence westerly to UTM North 5752541 metres East 313368 metres;

thence westerly to the northeast corner of District Lot 165 and continuing westerly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 165;

thence westerly in a straight line to the summit of Monarch Mountain;

thence westerly to UTM North 5754306 metres East 711262 metres;

thence north to the left bank natural boundary of the Talchako River at UTM North 5770916 metres;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the left bank natural boundaries of Talchako and Bella Coola Rivers to a point lying due South of the intersection of the right bank natural boundary of Burnt Bridge Creek with the right bank natural boundary of Bella Coola River;

thence due North to the intersection of the right bank natural boundary of Burnt Bridge Creek;

thence in a northerly along the right bank natural boundary of Burnt Bridge Creek to its intersection with the right bank natural boundary of an unnamed creek flowing southeasterly into Burnt Bridge Creek at approximately UTM North 5817097 metres;

thence in a westerly and northerly direction along the right bank natural boundary of the unnamed creek to the southerly shore natural boundary of the largest of the unnamed lakes, at the headwaters of the unnamed creek;

thence westerly and northerly along the southerly and westerly natural boundaries of the unnamed lake, to the lake's most northerly point, at approximately UTM North 5823926 metres UTM East 693085 metres;

thence due North to the summit of the "Cascade Mountains" as defined in the Interpretation Act ;

thence southerly to the northwest corner of District Lot 1432, being the point of commencement;

except those parts of Chilcotin-Bella Coola Highway, Number 20, as shown outlined in red on Ministry of Transportation and Highways' Drawings 47-A20-119, Sheets 1 to 17.

Secondly: all those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 4, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 5 Tube 1863; except Mineral Claim "XK1412" 241413.

The whole park containing approximately 989 714 hectares.

thence southeasterly along the right bank natural boundary of the unnamed creek to a point lying 240 metres due South and approximately 740 metres due West of the intersection between the right bank natural boundary of the unnamed creek and the left bank natural boundary of Meager Creek;

except (1) Mineral Claim "GPC #1" 332441; and (2) Mineral Claim "GPC #8" 332448.

WEST LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cariboo District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: the northwest 1/4 of District Lot 1887; except West Lake-Fraser River Road 330, a section 42 Transportation Act highway.

The northeast 1/4 of District Lot 1887; except West Lake-Fraser River Road.

The southeast 1/4 of District Lot 1887; except Plan 18350 and the old and new rights of way of the West Lake-Fraser River Road 330 as shown on Ministry of Transportation's Road Survey Plan 7511.

Lot 1 of District Lot 1887, Plan 18350.

That part of the southeast 1/4 of District Lot 1887 described as the Old West Lake-Fraser Road 330 shown outlined in green on Ministry of Transportation's Road Survey Plan 7511 and filed with the Parks Division, Victoria.

The southwest 1/4 of District Lot 1887.

Secondly: commencing at the northeast corner of District Lot 4292 lying on the natural boundary of Nadsilnich Lake;

thence East in a straight line to the northwest corner of District Lot 4297 lying on the natural boundary of Nadsilnich Lake;

thence in a general northerly, westerly and southwesterly direction along the natural boundary of Nadsilnich Lake to the point of commencement.

Thirdly: that part of the bed of Beaverly Creek contained within District Lot 1887.

The whole park containing approximately 256 hectares.

WEST SHAWNIGAN LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Malahat District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 1919; except (1) the Crown land that is the subject of the West Shawnigan Lake Road right of way Plan RS 1700-I; and (2) the Canadian National Railway right of way Plan 1201 O.S.

The whole park containing approximately 9.7 hectares.

WEST TWIN PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cariboo District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1847.

The whole park containing approximately 22 317 hectares.

WEYMER CREEK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Nootka District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at a point on the summit of an unnamed peak lying approximately due East 3.25 kilometres of the southeast corner of District Lot 21;

thence due West a distance of 100 metres;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 315° a distance of 337 metres;

thence westerly on a bearing of 271° a distance of approximately 350 metres to a point, being the northerly boundary of an unnamed road (G-7H);

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 312° a distance of approximately 290 metres to a point on an unnamed road (G-7H) on the northerly boundary of an unnamed road;

thence northerly along the northerly boundary of an unnamed road (G-7H) to a point lying northwesterly on a bearing of 342° a distance of approximately 545 metres from the point described in the previous sentence;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 307° a distance of approximately 325 metres to a point, being the northerly boundary of an unnamed road;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 331° a distance of approximately 740 metres to a point, being the natural boundary at the confluence of 2 tributaries of an unnamed creek flowing northwesterly into Tahsis Inlet, on the most westerly left bank of Tahsis Inlet;

thence northerly along that left bank a distance of 330 metres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 72° a distance of 620 metres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 8° a distance of 325 metres;

thence southeasterly on a bearing of 94° a distance of approximately 430 metres to a point, being the height of land forming the westerly boundary of the watershed of Perry River;

thence in a general southeasterly, southerly and southwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of Perry River to the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 316 hectares.

WHALEBOAT ISLAND MARINE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Nanaimo District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 5 Tube 1899.

The whole park containing approximately 11 hectares (4 hectares of upland and 7 hectares of foreshore).

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cariboo District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1839.

The whole park containing approximately 116 hectares.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Rupert District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 1902.

The whole park containing approximately 72 hectares.

WHITESWAN LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kootenay District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the point of intersection of the right bank of the Lussier River and the east boundary of Lot 4596;

thence due North to the 1 340 metre contour;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along the 1 340 metre contour to the point of intersection with the left bank of Mutton Creek;

thence along the left bank of Mutton Creek in a general southerly direction to the 1 280 metre contour;

thence in a general easterly then general northeasterly direction along the 1 280 metre contour to a point lying 1 200 metres due North of the northern boundary of Lot 10325;

thence due East approximately 1 750 metres to the point of intersection with the left bank of an unnamed creek and the 1 220 metre contour;

thence in a general southerly, then general easterly direction along the 1 220 metre contour to a point lying 600 metres east and 150 metres north of the point of intersection of the east side of the White River Forest Road right of way and the right bank of White River;

thence due South to the 1 220 metre contour;

thence in a general westerly, then general southerly direction along the 1 220 metre contour to the point of intersection with the left bank of Inlet Creek;

thence South 30° West for a distance of approximately 400 metres to the 1 280 metre contour;

thence in a general westerly direction along the 1 280 metre contour to a point lying 250 metres south and 150 metres east of the intersection of the left bank of Mutton Creek and the right bank of Lussier River;

thence due West to the 1 280 metre contour;

thence in a general northerly then general westerly direction along the 1 280 metre contour to its point of intersection with the east boundary of Lot 4596;

thence North along the east boundary of Lot 4596 to the point of commencement;

except (1) the land that is the subject of the rights of way of the White River Forest Road; (2) the land that is the subject of the White-Moscow Forest Road; (3) the land that is the subject of the White-Coyote Forest Road and the White-Rock Forest Road, as shown in red on Forest Service Engineering Drawing No. 13-316; and (4) the land that is the subject of and White-Inlet Forest Road, as shown in red on Forest Service Engineering Drawing No. 3-301.

The whole park containing approximately 1 994 hectares.

WINDERMERE LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kootenay District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Sublot 16 of District Lot 4596, Plan X32;

Block A, Plan DD 3268-I, District Lot 5118;

District Lot 107 except Plans 849 and 1203;

Lots 1 to 9 of District Lot 107, Plan 849;

Lot 1 of District Lot 346, Plan 5332.

The whole park containing approximately 220 hectares.

WIRE CACHE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 14 Tube 1789; except Forest Service Road, Project 564-02.

The whole park containing approximately 57 hectares.

WISTARIA PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 4, Coast District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: Block A of District Lot 916.

Secondly: the foreshore described as commencing at the point of intersection of the easterly boundary of District Lot 916 and the natural boundary of Ootsa Lake, being the 859.5 metre contour;

thence South along the easterly boundary of District Lot 916 a distance of approximately 40 metres;

thence along a line parallel and perpendicularly distance 40 metres from the natural boundary of Ootsa Lake in a general northwesterly direction to the point of intersection with the boundary of District Lot 916;

thence North along the westerly boundary of District Lot 916 a distance of approximately 40 metres to the natural boundary of Ootsa Lake;

thence along the natural boundary of Ootsa Lake in a general southeasterly direction to the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 40 hectares (30 hectares upland and 10 hectares of foreshore).

WOSS LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Rupert District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the southeast corner of District Lot 1145 lying on the westerly shore natural boundary of Woss Lake;

thence in a general southerly direction along the natural boundary of Woss Lake a distance of 800 metres;

thence on a bearing of 173° a distance of approximately 2.2 kilometres to a point of intersection of the easterly shore natural boundary of Woss Lake with the right bank natural boundary of an unnamed creek;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along the natural boundary of an unnamed creek a distance of 600 metres;

thence southeasterly on a bearing of 120° to a point of intersection with the height of land forming the easterly boundary of the watershed of Woss Lake;

thence in a general southerly, westerly and northerly direction along the easterly, southerly and westerly boundaries of the watershed of Woss Lake to a point being the point of intersection of the easterly boundary of the watershed of Woss Lake with the southerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek, which is tributary to Woss Lake and whose confluences in District Lot 1144;

thence in a general easterly and northerly direction along the southerly and easterly boundaries of the watershed of an unnamed creek to a point lying due West of the southwest corner of District Lot 1145;

thence due East to the southwest corner of District Lot 1145;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 1145 to the southeast corner of District Lot 1145, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 6 634.2 hectares.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kootenay District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 1893.
