ANHLUUT'UKWSIM LA X MIHL ANGWINGA'ASANSKWHL NISG̱A'A

[a.k.a. Nisg̱a'a Memorial Lava Bed Park]

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated within the Province of British Columbia and contained within the following described boundaries, the UTM Coordinates herein being in UTM Zone 9 and referred to the NAD83(CSRS) Datum:

Commencing at post #54 as shown on Plan NR51 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 12TU1896 Crown Land Registry, being the southeast corner of District Lot 1093, Cassiar District;

thence following the survey boundary of Plan NR51 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 12TU1896 Crown Land Registry, to post #53 as shown on Plan NR72 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 11TU1997 Crown Land Registry;

thence following the survey boundaries of Plan NR72 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 11TU1997 Crown Land Registry, through post #52WT to corner #52 on the left natural boundary of Nass River;

thence northeasterly along the left natural boundary of Nass River to the southerly boundary of District Lot 1094, Cassiar District;

thence easterly and northerly along the southerly and easterly boundaries of District Lot 1094 to the southerly boundary of District Lot 7283, Cassiar District;

thence easterly and northerly along the southerly and easterly boundaries of District Lot 7283 to the left natural boundary of the channel of Nass River lying to the south and east of District Lot 7282, Cassiar District;

thence northeasterly along the left natural boundary of the channel of Nass River lying to the south and east of District Lot 7282, and continuing along the left natural boundary of Nass River to the southerly boundary of District Lot 5287, Cassiar District;

thence easterly and northerly along the southerly and easterly boundaries of District Lot 5287 to the left natural boundary of Nass River;

thence northeasterly along the left natural boundary of Nass River to the left natural boundary of Ksi Sii Aks;

thence easterly along the left natural boundary of Ksi Sii Aks to the westerly rectilinear boundary of District Lot 4827, Cassiar District;

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 4827 to corner #51 on the left natural boundary of Ksi Sii Aks and being on a line drawn parallel to and 460 metres perpendicularly distant northerly from the southerly boundary of the Northwest ¼ of District Lot 4011, Cassiar District;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of District Lot 4012 to the right natural boundary of Ksi Sii Aks;

thence following the survey boundaries of Plan NR52 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 13TU1896 Crown Land Registry, through post #64 Wt, corner 63b, and corner 63a to post #63;

thence following the survey boundaries of Plan NR51 Lisims Land Registry, Plan 12TU1896 Crown Land Registry, through post #62, post #61, corner 60a, post #60, corner 59a, post #59, corner 58a, and post #58 Wt to corner #58 on the left natural boundary of Ksi Ts'oohl Ts'ap;

secondly, all lands related to Nisg̱a'a Highway No. 113 on which a provincial public undertaking, as defined in the Transportation Act , is located;

thirdly, all those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, contained within the following described boundaries and containing 0.858 hectares more or less: a 30 metre wide corridor centred on a line commencing 12.5 metres perpendicularly distant northeasterly from the centre line of Nisg̱a'a Highway No. 113 at UTM Coordinate N 6115786m; thence to UTM Coordinate N 6115955m E 494491m; thence to UTM Coordinate N 6115971m E 494963m; thence to UTM Coordinate N 6115971m E 494999m; thence along a grid bearing of 118° 13' 00" to the boundary of Nisg̱a'a Lands, and the said line produced;

fourthly, all those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, contained within the following described boundaries and containing 10.5 hectares more or less: commencing at the intersection of the northerly boundary of the park, the limits of which are defined by UTM Coordinates N 6105640m E 502240m and N 6106630m E 504175m, and a line having a grid bearing of 159° 46' 28" through UTM Coordinate N 6106080.8m E 503099.3m; thence northeasterly along the said northerly boundary of the park 40.28 metres; thence on a grid bearing of 159° 46' 28" a distance of 169.1 metres; thence on a grid bearing of 69° 46' 28" a distance of 12.0 metres; thence on a grid bearing of 159° 46' 28" a distance of 897 metres more or less to the intersection with a portion of the southerly boundary of the park; thence southwesterly along the portion of the said southerly boundary to a line drawn parallel to and perpendicularly distant 104 metres from the last described line bearing 159° 46' 28"; thence on a grid bearing of 339° 46' 28" a distance of 889 metres more or less to a point lying on a grid bearing of 249° 46' 28" from the southerly limit of the 169.1 metre boundary described above; thence on a grid bearing of 69° 46' 28" a distance of 22.0 metres; thence on a grid bearing of 339° 46' 28" a distance of 161 metres more or less to the said northerly boundary of the park; thence northeasterly and along the said northerly boundary of the park a distance of 30.2 metres more or less to the point of commencement;

fifthly, all those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, contained within the described boundaries as shown on Plan 14TU2010 Crown Land Registry; and

sixthly, that portion of unsurveyed Crown land shown as road (now known as Anlaw Road) on Plan 11TU1711 Crown Land Registry, lying southeasterly of the Nass River.

The whole park containing approximately 17 717 hectares.

ANSTEY HUNAKWA PARK

BLIGH ISLAND MARINE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Nootka District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Bligh Island, being due West of the northwest corner of District Lot 156;

thence in a general easterly and northerly direction following the northerly and westerly boundaries of the watersheds of three unnamed creeks flowing southerly into Nootka Sound to the westerly boundary of the watershed of Ewin Inlet;

thence in a general northerly and easterly direction following the westerly and northerly boundaries of the watershed of Ewin Inlet to a point lying due East 880 metres and due South 250 metres from the northeast corner of District Lot 154;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to a point, lying due East of the southeast corner of District Lot 154 on the easterly shore natural boundary of Bligh Island;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 155° a distance of approximately 1.2 kilometres to a point being the middle line of Zuciarte Channel, and being the administration boundary between Nootka District and Clayoquot District;

thence southerly along the middle line of Zuciarte Channel to a point lying due South a distance of 1.46 kilometres from the northeast corner of District Lot 157;

thence due West into Cook Channel, Nootka Sound, a distance of 5.4 kilometres;

thence due North into Eliza Passage, Nootka Sound, a distance of 8.2 kilometres;

thence due East into Nootka Sound a distance of 2.6 kilometres to a point lying due West 2.1 kilometres and due South approximately 50 metres from the northwest corner of District Lot 105;

thence due South a distance of approximately 3.3 kilometres, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 4 455.6 hectares (1 584 hectares of upland and 2 871.6 hectares of foreshore).

E. C. MANNING PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Yale Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 1813; except (1) Highway 3 as shown on Land Title Office Plans H150, H151, H157, H158, H215, H216, H217, H218, H219, H17630, EPP108185, EPP108186, EPP126770 and EPP127373, all on deposit in the Kamloops Land Title Office; and (2) District Lots 1971, 1972 and 1973, Yale Division Yale District, as shown on Plans EPC2229 and EPC2206, on deposit in the Crown Land Registry.

Secondly: commencing at the point of confluence between the middle threads of Coates Creek and Holding Creek, said point of confluence lying 3 800 metres west and 600 metres north, more or less, from the summit of Granite Mountain;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the middle thread of Holding Creek to the point of confluence with the middle thread of Tulameen River;

thence in a straight line on a bearing of 278° a distance of 1 550 metres, more or less, to the height of land forming the northerly boundary of the watershed of an unnamed creek flowing easterly into the Tulameen River;

thence in a general westerly direction along said unnamed watershed boundary to the southeasterly boundary of the watershed of Podunk Creek;

thence in a general southwesterly direction along said southeasterly boundary of the watershed of Podunk Creek to an unnamed peak at UTM Zone 10 North 5463192 metres+/− East 643502 metres+/−, being also on the northerly boundary of E. C. Manning Park as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 1813;

thence in general northeasterly, southerly, southeasterly and easterly directions along the northerly boundary of E. C. Manning Park as shown on the said Official Plan to a point thereon, said point lying on the easterly boundary of the watershed of Skaist River;

thence in a general northerly direction along the easterly boundaries of the watersheds of Skaist River and Tulameen River to the summit of Granite Mountain;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the point of confluence between the middle threads of Coates Creek and Holding Creek, being also the point of commencement.

Thirdly: District Lot 1938, District Lot 1939, District Lot 1940 and District Lot 1941 as shown on Plan EPC1255 deposited in the Crown Land Registry.

Fourthly: District Lot 1942, District Lot 1943, District Lot 1944 and District Lot 1945 as shown on Plan EPC1280 deposited in the Crown Land Registry.

Fifthly: District Lot 1946 as shown on Plan EPC1423 deposited in the Crown Land Registry.

The whole park containing approximately 83 669 hectares .

FRENCH BAR CREEK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Lillooet District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 1995; except a 50 metre corridor between the south and north boundaries of the park centred on the following UTM Zone 10 coordinates: North 5675125 metres East 558046 metres, North 5675200 metres East 558041 metres, North 5675230 metres East 558008 metres, North 5675244 metres East 558011 metres, North 5675275 metres East 558043 metres, North 5675352 metres East 558041 metres, North 5675436 metres East 558044 metres, North 5675477 metres East 558046 metres, North 5675598 metres East 558041 metres, North 5675728 metres East 558027 metres, North 5675824 metres East 557997 metres.

The whole park containing approximately 1 159 hectares.

The whole park containing approximately 912 hectares.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Barclay District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at a point on the southeasterly boundary of the watershed of Hitchie Creek lying due West 380 metres and due North approximately 800 metres from the northwest corner of "Homitan" Indian Reserve No. 8 and being on the boundary of the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve;

thence in a northeasterly direction along the Hitchie Creek watershed boundary a distance of approximately 2.3 kilometres to a point lying due East of the headwaters of an unnamed creek flowing northwesterly into Hitchie Creek and approximately 200 metres due North from the northerly boundary of District Lot 563;

thence due West to the headwaters of the unnamed creek and continuing northwesterly along the left bank natural boundary of Hitchie creek to the point of confluence with the left bank natural boundary of Hitchie Creek;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 320° a distance of approximately 850 metres to a point on the westerly boundary of the watershed of Hitchie Creek;

thence in a southwesterly direction along the Hitchie Creek watershed boundary a distance of approximately 900 metres to the intersection with the northeasterly boundary of Pacific Rim National Park Reserve;

thence southeasterly and southerly along the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve to the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 247 hectares.

KIANUKO PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kootenay District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the northeast corner of District Lot 8890 surveyed as Mineral Claim "E.D. Lee" 2;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of Mineral Claim "E.D. Lee" 2, produced a distance of approximately 200 metres to the easterly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek passing through the summit of Putman Peak, to the summit of an unnamed mountain which is a point on the Kianuko Creek watershed boundary lying 450 metres due West and approximately 2.05 kilometres due South of Putman Peak, and which is also a point on the watershed boundary separating 2 unnamed creeks that are tributary to, and which flows southeasterly into, Goat River;

thence southeasterly along the watershed boundary of the unnamed creeks to their intersection with a 5 000 foot (1 524 metre) contour;

thence southerly and westerly along the 5 000 foot (1 524 metre) contour to a point lying 1.35 kilometres due East of the most northerly intersection of the left bank natural boundary of Skelly Creek with the right bank natural boundary of Kianuko Creek;

thence southwesterly in a straight line on a bearing of 258° a distance of approximately 1.3 kilometres to the left bank natural boundary of Kianuko Creek;

thence northerly along the natural boundary of Kianuko Creek to a point lying due East of the most northerly intersection of the left bank natural boundary of Skelly Creek with the right bank natural boundary of Kianuko Creek;

thence due West to the most northerly intersection;

thence westerly along the most northerly natural boundary of Skelly Creek a distance of 600 metres;

thence northwesterly in a straight line on a bearing of 328° a distance of 800 metres;

thence northwesterly in a straight line on a bearing of 297° a distance of approximately 750 metres to the westerly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the westerly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek, passing through the summit of Craig Peak, to the summit of an unnamed mountain which is a point on the Kianuko Creek watershed boundary lying 250 metres due East and approximately 1.45 kilometres due North of Craig Peak;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the intersection of the middle line of Sanca Creek with a 6 300 foot (1 920 metre) contour;

thence northwesterly in a straight line to the summit of an unnamed mountain situated on the northerly boundary of the watershed of Sanca Creek and lying 1.8 kilometres due East and approximately 300 metres due North of Mount Goodwin;

thence in a general northeasterly direction along the northerly boundaries of the watersheds of Sanca Creek and Kianuko Creek, passing through Haystack Mountain, to the easterly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek;

thence southerly along the easterly boundary of the watershed of Kianuko Creek, passing through the summit of Gillis Peak, to the northerly boundary of District Lot 8890, surveyed as Mineral Claim "E.D. Lee" 2;

thence easterly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 8890 to the northeast corner of District Lot 8890, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 11 637.9 hectares.

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 65° a distance of approximately 550 metres to a point lying 2.75 kilometres due West and approximately 1.9 kilometres due North from the northwest corner of District Lot 3437 on the natural boundary of an unnamed lake, that flows southeasterly into West Road (Blackwater) River;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 71° a distance of 860 metres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 83° a distance of 300 metres;

thence due East a distance of 2.7 kilometres;

thence due East a distance of 2.6 kilometres;

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in New Westminster District and Yale Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the summit of Mehatl Peak;

thence southeasterly in a straight line to the summit of Tiara Tower;

thence on a bearing of 130° a distance of approximately 4.64 kilometres to the easterly boundary of the watershed of Mehatl Creek;

thence in a general southerly direction along the easterly boundary of the watershed of Mehatl Creek to the North Limit of the Railway Belt, being also the boundary between New Westminster District and Yale Division, Yale District;

thence southerly along the North Limit of the Railway Belt to the middle line of Nahatlatch River;

thence in a general southwesterly direction along the middle line of Nahatlatch River to the southeasterly prolongation of the right bank natural boundary of the first unnamed creek flowing southeasterly into Nahatlatch River situated southwest of Whistlepig Creek;

thence northwesterly along the southeasterly prolongation to the right bank natural boundary of the unnamed creek flowing southeasterly into Nahatlatch River;

thence on a bearing of 309° a distance of approximately 3.9 kilometres to a point on the height of land separating the watersheds of Mehatl Creek and Nahatlatch River;

thence in a general northwesterly direction along the height of land to the Summit of Mount Widdess;

thence northerly in a straight line a distance of approximately 4.68 kilometres to the summit of an unnamed mountain lying approximately 2.28 kilometres due West and approximately 2.65 kilometres due South of the confluence of the middle lines of North Mehatl Creek and Mehatl Creek;

thence northwesterly in a straight line a distance of approximately 18.6 kilometres to the summit of an unnamed mountain separating the watersheds of Mehatl Creek, Nahatlatch River and Rogers Creek;

thence northeasterly, easterly and southeasterly along the northwesterly, northerly and northeasterly boundaries of the watershed of Mehatl Creek to the summit of Mehatl Peak, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 23 860 hectares.

NENIKË​KH/NANIKA-KIDPRICE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 4, Coast District and Range 5, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 12 Tube 1984; except (1) Mineral Claim 537570; (2) Mineral Claim 537571; (3) Mineral Claim 537573; (4) Mineral Claim "Lucky Ship" 554120; and (5) Forest Licence A16828, Cutblock KIDP 0023.

The whole park containing approximately 17 006 hectares.

NORTH THOMPSON OXBOWS JENSEN ISLAND PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the southwest corner of Lot 1, Section 10, Township 22, Range 17, W6M, Plan 22436, being a point on the left bank natural boundary of a backwater of North Thompson River;

thence due West to the right bank natural boundary of the backwater of North Thompson River;

thence in general northerly, easterly and southerly directions along the backwater right bank natural boundary to a point lying due East of the most southerly southeast corner of District Lot 1780;

thence due West to the most southerly southeast corner of District Lot 1780, on the left bank natural boundary of the backwater of North Thompson River;

thence in general northerly, westerly and southerly directions along the left bank natural boundary to the southwest corner of Lot 1, Section 10, Township 22, Range 17, W6M, Plan 22436, being the point of commencement.

The whole park containing approximately 30 hectares.

NORTHERN ROCKY MOUNTAINS PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Peace River District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 7 Tube 1878; except District Lot 699.

The whole park containing approximately 665 709 hectares.

NUNTSI PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Lillooet District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 15 Tube 1918.

The whole park containing approximately 20 570 hectares (20 538 hectares of upland and 32 hectares of foreshore).

OKANAGAN MOUNTAIN PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Similkameen Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 8 Tube 2024.

The whole park containing approximately 11 321 hectares.

OLD MAN LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 5, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 15 Tube 1984.

The whole park containing approximately 326 hectares.

OMINECA PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cassiar District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 7 Tube 2024.

The whole park containing approximately 132 417 hectares.

OREGANA CREEK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 1852; except (1) a 30 metre right of way centred on the Ministry of Forests and Range road FSR 0565-03, Finn-Tum from the west boundary of the park to the middle thread of Oregana Creek; (2) a 40 metre right of way 25 metres perpendicularly distant easterly and 15 metres perpendicularly distant westerly from the centerline of Ministry of Forests and Range road FSR 0565-03, Finn-Tum lying north of the middle thread of Oregana Creek; (3) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests and Range permit road R15237, Bear Spur; (4) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests and Range permit road R15236-1200; (5) a gravel pit contained within the described boundaries in UTM Zone 11 commencing at the junction of the centre lines of roads FSR 0565-03, Finn-Tum and R15236-1200 at UTM North 5761520 metres +/−, thence southerly along the centre line of road R15236-1200 to UTM North 5761335 metres, thence to UTM North 5761335 metres East 356820 metres, thence to UTM North 5761465 metres East 356820 metres, thence to the point of commencement; and (6) a 50 metre right of way 40 metres perpendicularly distant westerly and 10 metres perpendicularly distant easterly from the centre line of Ministry of Forests and Range permit road R15236-1100.

The whole park containing approximately 286 hectares.

OREGON JACK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 20 Tube 1780; except a section 42 Transportation Act highway right of way identified as Hat Creek Road 2101.

The whole park containing approximately 230 hectares.

PAINTED BLUFFS PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1783; except (1) the Canadian National Railway right of way, being Plan A533; and (2) District Lots 2197, 2198, 2199 and 2200.

The whole park containing approximately 98 hectares.

PATTERSON LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 2, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 2006; except a 20 metre right of way centred on the non-status road.

The whole park containing approximately 1 595 hectares.

PAUL LAKE PARK

The whole park containing approximately 728 hectares.

PENNASK CREEK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 7 Tube 1915; except (1) Okanagan Connector Highway No. 97C as shown on Official Plan 13 Tube 1498; (2) a 30 metre right of way centred on resource roads within and along Official Plan 8 Tube 1328, Plan 12 Tube 850 and Plan 2 Tube 854 (being BC Hydro rights of way); and (3) Official Plan 14 Tube 1498; (4) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests' Sunset Lake Forest Service Road 8695.01; and (5) a 20 metre right of way centred on the existing non-status road accessing the Hidden Lake area.

The whole park containing approximately 1 243 hectares.

PILLAR PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1876; except Ministry of Transportation's Chase-Falkland Road RS7880, Gazetted June 17, 1982.

The whole park containing approximately 2.34 hectares.

PINE LE MORAY PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Peace River District and Cariboo District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Firstly: the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 7 Tube 1847; except (1) the right of way of the British Columbia Railway, District Lot 13049, Cariboo District, shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as 6RY307; (2) the right of way of the British Columbia Railway, District Lot 4081, Peace River District shown on the preliminary plan prepared by Tom J. Tryon, BCLS, the survey completed October 26, 2000, a copy of which is on file with Crown Land Registry as 5RY307; (3) the right of way of the British Columbia Railway, District Lot 4082, Peace River District shown on the preliminary plan prepared by Tom J. Tryon, BCLS, the survey completed October 20, 2000, a copy of which is on file with Crown Land Registry as 4RY307; and (4) a 50 metre strip of land southerly and easterly of the pipeline right of way shown on the Official Plans deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 508 and Plan 2 Tube 508.

Secondly: the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 14 Tube 1870; except (1) Ministry of Transportation's Gravel Reserve 0239965; and (2) the right of way of the British Columbia Railway, District Lot 13049, Cariboo District, shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as 6RY307.

The whole park containing approximately 43 245 hectares.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Group 1, New Westminster District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the northeast corner of "Pitt Lake" Indian Reserve No. 4, being a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Pitt Lake;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of "Pitt Lake" Indian Reserve No. 4 to the easterly boundary of Fractional Legal Subdivision 3, Section 9, Township 5, Range 5, W7M;

thence northerly and westerly along the easterly and northerly boundaries of the Fractional Legal Subdivision 3 to the easterly boundary of Section 12, Township 41, ECM;

PINK MOUNTAIN PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Peace River District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 11 Tube 1779; except Petroleum and Natural Gas Tenure 10001.

The whole park containing approximately 92 hectares.

The whole park containing approximately 43 hectares.

QUESNEL LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Lillooet District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 14 Tube 1992; except a 20 metre right of way centred on Deka Lake Road ending at the boundary of District Lot 8175.

The whole park containing approximately 385 hectares.

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 1179 to the southeast corner of District Lot 1179, being a point on the easterly shore natural boundary of Read Island;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of District Lot 285 to the northwest corner of District Lot 948;

thence southerly and easterly along the westerly and southerly boundaries of District Lot 948 to a point on the westerly shore natural boundary of Rosen Lake;

thence due East to a point lying due South of the most easterly southeast corner of District Lot 948;

thence due North to the most easterly southeast corner;

thence northerly along the easterly boundary of District Lot 948 to the southwest corner of District Lot 286;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of District Lot 1179 to the southwest corner of District Lot 1179, being the point of commencement.

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

thence westerly, southerly and easterly along the northerly, westerly and southerly boundaries of the east 1/2 of Legal Subdivision 14 to the northwest corner of Legal Subdivision 10, Section 15, Township 15, Range 27, W6M;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 10, Section 15, to the southwest corner of Legal Subdivision 10;

thence easterly along the southerly boundary of Legal Subdivision 10 a distance of approximately 170 metres to a point lying on the southeasterly boundary of the watershed of Stein River;

thence in a general southwesterly, westerly, northerly and easterly direction along the southeasterly, southerly, westerly and northerly boundary of the watershed of Stein River, passing through the summits of Nikaia and Skihist Mountains, Claimpost Peak, Antimony Mountain, Doss Peak, Mount Nielson, Kwoiet and Mehatl Peaks, Mount Klackarpun, Crevasse Crag, Gott Peak and Siwhe and Stein Mountains, to a point on the northerly boundary of the Stein River watershed lying due West 1.0 kilometre and South approximately 650 metres from the northwest corner of "Stryen" Indian Reserve No. 9;

thence due East to the westerly boundary of "Stryen" Indian Reserve No. 9;

thence southeasterly, easterly and southerly along the westerly, southerly and westerly boundaries of "Stryen" Indian Reserve No. 9 to the northwest corner of "Lytton" Indian Reserve No. 9B;

thence southerly along the westerly boundary of "Lytton" Indian Reserve No. 9B to the southwest corner of "Lytton" Indian Reserve No. 9B, being the point of commencement;

except District Lot 1769.

The whole park containing approximately 107 191 hectares.

WALHACHIN OXBOWS PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at the point of intersection with the easterly boundary of District Lot 2457, being "Skeetchestin" Indian Reserve and the left bank natural boundary of the main channel of the Thompson River;

thence due North to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 15 metres perpendicularly distant from the left bank natural boundary of the Thompson River;

thence in a general southeasterly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 15 metres perpendicularly distant from the left bank natural boundary of Thompson River to a point lying due East of the intersection of the northerly boundary of Canadian Pacific Railway right of way, Plan A786, and the natural boundary of the Thompson River;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of Canadian Pacific Railway right of way, Plan A786, to the intersection with the natural boundary of the Thompson River;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of Canadian Pacific Railway right of way, Plan A786, to the intersection with the natural boundary of a backwater (oxbow) of the Thompson River;

thence due North to a point on a line drawn parallel to and 15 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of a backwater (oxbow) of the Thompson River;

thence in an easterly and northerly direction along a line drawn parallel to and 15 metres perpendicularly distant from the natural boundary of the backwater (oxbow) of the Thompson River to a point lying due South of the southerly prolongation of the easterly boundary of District Lot 2457, being "Skeetchestin" Indian Reserve;

thence northerly along the prolongation and the easterly boundary of District Lot 2457 to the point of intersection with the left bank natural boundary of the main channel of Thompson River, being the point of commencement;

except Canadian National Railway right of way, Plan A261.

The whole park containing approximately 37 hectares (35 hectares of upland and 2 hectares of foreshore).

WAP CREEK PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 1990.

The whole park containing approximately 328 hectares (314 hectares of upland and 14 hectares of foreshore).

WELLS GRAY PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District, Lillooet District and Cariboo District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 2004; except (1) Clearwater Valley Road as shown on the Official Plans deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 2 Tube 1562, Plan 4 Tube 1432, Plan 10 Tube 1529, Plan 11 Tube 1529, Plan 12 Tube 1529, Plan 12 Tube 1533, Plan 13 Tube 1533, Plan 16 Tube 1537 and Plan 17 Tube 1537, on Plan 40616, on deposit in the Kamloops Land Title Office, and on Road Survey No. 5709, on file with Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure in Kamloops; (2) Helmcken Falls Road as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 9 Tube 1529; and (3) 1.845 hectares described as WGPP on Ministry of Transportation's (File #2021, Project 21924) Drawing R2-600-101-RW.

The whole park containing approximately 541 516 hectares.

WHITE LAKE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Kamloops Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 4 Tube 1877; except (1) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests' Pari Creek Road No. 9701-00; and (2) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests' Bastion-White Lake Road No. 5653-04.

The whole park containing approximately 266 hectares (204 hectares of upland and 62 hectares of foreshore).

WHITE PELICAN PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cariboo District and contained within the following described boundaries:

Commencing at a point on the northwesterly shore natural boundary of Beaver Lake lying due South of the southeast corner of District Lot 7249, being "Anahim" Indian Reserve No. 13;

thence southwesterly along the natural boundary of Beaver Lake to a point lying due East from the northeast corner of District Lot 7248;

thence due West to the northeast corner of District Lot 7248;

thence westerly along the northerly boundary of District Lot 7248 to the northwest corner of District Lot 7248;

thence due West a distance 600 metres;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 301° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 322° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 338° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence northwesterly on a bearing of 347° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 4° a distance of 1.3 kilometres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 26° a distance of 1.2 kilometres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 37° a distance of 1.7 kilometres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 50° a distance of 1.5 kilometres;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 75° a distance of 1.0 kilometre;

thence northeasterly on a bearing of 85° a distance of 800 metres;

thence southeasterly on a bearing of 105° a distance of 800 metres;

thence southeasterly on a bearing of 137° a distance of 600 metres;

thence due South a distance of 1.5 kilometres;

thence southeasterly on a bearing of 166° a distance of 2.7 kilometres;

thence due South a distance of 1.3 kilometres;

thence southwesterly in a straight line to a point on the natural boundary of Beaver Lake lying due South of the southeast corner of District Lot 7249, being the point of commencement;

except (1) District Lot 7249, "Anahim" Indian Reserve No. 13; (2) District Lot 7251, "Anahim" Indian Reserve No. 14; and (3) District Lot 10216, "Anahim" Indian Reserve No. 15.

The whole park containing approximately 2 762.8 hectares.

WHITE RIDGE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Nootka District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 6 Tube 2012.

The whole park containing approximately 1 386 hectares.

WRINKLY FACE PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Osoyoos Division, Yale District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 5 Tube 1877; except Ministry of Forests' Cutting Permit A 54185 CB1.

The whole park containing approximately 43 hectares.

YALAKOM PARK

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Lillooet District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 8 Tube 1995.

The whole park containing approximately 8 941 hectares.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 8 463 hectares.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 83 hectares.

NEĞIƛ/NEKITE ESTUARY CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 2, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 8 Tube 1970; except (1) a 30 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests and Range road FSR 8366; and (2) the land and water contained within the boundaries described as follows: commencing at UTM Zone 9 North 5693610 metres East 630700 metres; thence to the easterly 15 metre offset from the centre line of road FSR 8366-01, Nekite Mainline, at UTM Zone 9 North 5693610 metres East 630611 metres +/−; thence northerly along the easterly 15 metre offset from FSR 8366-01, Nekite Mainline, to UTM Zone 9 North 5693930 metres East 630569 metres +/−; thence to UTM Zone 9 North 5693930 metres East 630700 metres; thence to UTM Zone 9 North 5693610 metres East 630700 metres, being the point of commencement.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 481 hectares (331 hectares of upland and 150 hectares of foreshore).

PAŁƏMIN/ESTERO BASIN CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 1, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 1 Tube 1968; except (1) a 100 metre right of way centred on Ministry of Forests and Range road FSR 9125-01; and (2) that part in Frederick Arm below the natural boundary of the sea.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 2 978 hectares (2 330 hectares of upland and 648 hectares of foreshore).

TLALL CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Queen Charlotte District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 3 Tube 2005; except (1) the Highway 16 right of way as shown on Plan PRP 8300 and on Plan 10, Tube 592 deposited in the Crown Land Registry; (2) a 30 metre road right of way centred on the Ministry of Forests and Range permit road R13349-4, Survey Main; and (3) a 30 metre right of way centred on the non-status road north of Lawn Creek through District Lot 257.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 16 231 hectares (16 209 hectares of upland and 22 hectares of foreshore).

TROUP PASSAGE CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 3, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 14 Tube 1969; except that part below the natural boundary of the sea.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 2 617 hectares.

UG w IWA'/CAPE CAUTION – BLUNDEN BAY CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Range 2, Coast District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 10 Tube 2008.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 331 hectares (237 hectares of upland and 94 hectares of foreshore).

UPPER GLADYS RIVER/WATSÍX DEIYI CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cassiar District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 12 Tube 2008.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 56 358 hectares.

WILLISON CREEK – NELSON LAKE/SÍT' HÉENI CONSERVANCY

All those parcels or tracts of Crown land, together with all that foreshore or land covered by water, situated in Cassiar District and contained within the described boundaries as shown on the Official Plan deposited in the Crown Land Registry as Plan 5 Tube 2010; except those portions of Mineral Claim 829202 and Mineral Claim 829222 lying outside the boundary of the mineral reserve established as site number 1005127 under B.C. Reg. 280/2007.

The whole conservancy containing approximately 10 300 hectares.
